intro: Triaspis auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate triaspis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
